text:
...although we should think twice before adding one: it's huge, and the
validation might have a hefty performance impact on the whole server. as long as
we can be reasonably sure it's only openoffice, we should be fine, but as soon
as other vendors start implementing it, it's nitpicking time.

creator: lars.nooden@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #0)

      "... but as soon as other vendors start implementing 
       it, it's nitpicking time."

Actually, there have been two independent implementations for a while.  Koffice
was the first to implement ODF and OpenOffice.org was second.  Lotus Notes 8
will be using it (the beta does already).  

There is a viewer plug-in for FireFox, though currently limited to
wordprocessing files.  The browser has wide usage even if the plugin and the
above office suites have not achieved the same level of market penetration.  
   https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/1888

There is also a working plug-in for MS Office XP, 2000, and 2003:
   http://www.sun.com/software/star/odf_plugin/

So, soon "nitpicking time" should be at least placed on the calendar. ;)
agreed. but by definition, nit-picking time is after the next release :)
